page.title: 10FILKINS: ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: The Carter Institute-the Village Hall- is the centre of village social activi- ties. An extension is being built, paid for by village fund-raising, using the Manpower Services Commission for economy; this will give an enlarged kitchen and improved toilet facilities. The Hall is used for Club meetings,fund raising events, for discos and bingo, & can be hired cheaply for private cele- brations. Barn Dances are popular, and in good weather, these are held in a local large garden. The Victorian Church of St Peter has been used most effectively recently for a concert of music & poetry and for seasonal presen- tations by the children. For many, the local pub, the Lamb, is the natural place to gather to exchange village news and views. Food is served every day and there is a pleasant beer garden with games facilities.
